analyzed: rlung gi khams bdag med do // zhes bya bar ston / rlung gi khams mi sdug go /
translated: He teaches that the wind element is not attractive.🔽He teaches that the wind element is empty.🔽He teaches that the wind element is signless.🔽He teaches that the wind element is wishless.🔽He teaches that the wind element is calm.🔽He teaches that the wind element is isolated.🔽He teaches that the wind element is dependently arisen.🔽He teaches that the wind element is not produced by itself, not produced by another, not produced by both, and not produced by Ishvara, time, atoms, or primary matter, and that it does not arise by chance.🔽He teaches that the wind element is not fettered and not liberated.

original: zhes bya bar ston cing /
analyzed: zhes bya bar ston cing /
translated: He teaches that the wind element is not to be viewed as a basis, not to be viewed as a support, and not to be viewed as an object of enjoyment.

original: 'di skad du gang de ltar spyod pa ni /
analyzed: 'di skad du gang de ltar spyod pa ni /
translated: He teaches that the wind element is not past, future, or present.🔽He teaches that the wind element is not to be viewed as internal, not to be viewed as external, and not to be viewed as both.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //🔽zhes brjod de /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do // zhes brjod de /
translated: He teaches that the wind element is not to be viewed as form, not to be viewed as feeling, not to be viewed as perception, not to be viewed as volitional factors, and not to be viewed as consciousness.

original: su la bstan pa de dag kyang rlung gi khams mi rtag ces bya bar rtog par 'gyur ro //🔽rlung gi khams sdug bsngal zhes bya bar rtog par 'gyur ro //🔽rlung gi khams bdag med ces bya bar rtog par 'gyur ro //

translated: He teaches that the wind element is not to be viewed as the earth element, not to be viewed as the water element, not to be viewed as the fire element, and not to be viewed as the wind element.🔽He teaches that the wind element is not to be viewed as the space element.

original: rlung gi khams mi sdug ces bya bar rtog par 'gyur ro //🔽de ltar de dag rlung gi khams mi rtag go /🔽zhes bya bar rtog pa dang / rlung gi khams sdug bsngal lo //

original: zhes bya bar rtog pa dang / rlung gi khams bdag med do //

translated: They teach that the space element is impermanent.

translated: and that the formless absorptions are without aspirations,🔽and that the formless absorptions are calm,🔽and that the formless absorptions are secluded,🔽and that the formless absorptions are void,🔽and that the formless absorptions are purified,

translated: and that the formless absorptions are not extinguished,🔽and that the formless absorptions are not produced,🔽and that the formless absorptions are unarisen,🔽and that the formless absorptions are unceasing,🔽and that the formless absorptions are non-entities,🔽and that the formless absorptions are emptiness,🔽and that the formless absorptions are signless,🔽and that the formless absorptions are without aspirations,🔽and that the formless absorptions are the perfection of wisdom,

translated: and that the formless absorptions are the applications of mindfulness,🔽and that the formless absorptions are the right efforts,🔽and that the formless absorptions are the legs of miraculous power,🔽and that the formless absorptions are the faculties,🔽and that the formless absorptions are the powers,🔽and that the formless absorptions are the branches of enlightenment,🔽and that the formless absorptions are the path,🔽and that the formless absorptions are the ten powers of a tathāgata,🔽and that the formless absorptions are the four fearlessnesses,🔽and that the formless absorptions are the four detailed and thorough knowledges,🔽and that the formless absorptions are the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,🔽and that the formless absorptions are great love,🔽and that the formless absorptions are great compassion,🔽and that the formless absorptions are the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening,🔽and that the formless absorptions are the emptiness of internal phenomena,🔽and that the formless absorptions are the emptiness of external phenomena,🔽and that the formless absorptions are the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena,

translated: and that the formless absorptions are the emptiness of emptiness,🔽and that the formless absorptions are the emptiness of great extent,🔽and that the formless absorptions are the emptiness of ultimate reality,🔽and that the formless absorptions are the emptiness of conditioned phenomena,🔽and that the formless absorptions are the emptiness

analyzed: zhes bya bar ston /

analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid bdag med do // zhes bya bar ston /

analyzed: su la bstan pa de dag kyang lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid mi rtag ces bya bar rtog par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid bdag med ces bya bar rtog par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid mi sdug ces bya bar rtog par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: rigs kyi bu khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgoms dang / byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Son of noble family, you should cultivate the perfection of wisdom, and you will enter into the faultlessness of the bodhisattvas.

original: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: You will attain acceptance that phenomena are unborn.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and you will travel from buddha realm to buddha realm.

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ston to //

analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

translated: those sons of noble family or daughters of noble family also teach the sons of noble family or daughters of noble family in the Bodhisattva Vehicle as follows:🔽“Sons of noble family or daughters of noble family, you should not train in the perfection of wisdom in a way that is dualistic.

original: tshur rigs kyi bu khyod kyis 'das pa dang ma byon pa dang da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis thugs dang po bskyed ba nas phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su
analyzed: tshur rigs kyi bu khyod kyis 'das pa dang ma byon pa dang da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis thugs dang po bskyed ba nas phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su
translated: The buddhas will say, Son of good family, you should know that the tathagatas, arhats, and perfectly enlightened buddhas of the past, present, and future, from the time they first give rise to bodhichitta until they attain🔽the dharmakaya and enter into the expanse of nirvana that is devoid of the🔽sheaths of samsaric existence,🔽

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus te /🔽rjes su dga' bar gyis la /🔽bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su sngos shig /🔽ces rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag la de ltar ston cing /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus te / rjes su dga' bar gyis la / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su sngos shig / ces rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag la de ltar ston cing /
translated: You should rejoice in all the roots of virtue of the tathāgatas, the arhats, the perfectly enlightened buddhas of the past, future, and present, from the time when they first produced the thought [of awakening] up to when they fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood, and from when they turned the wheel of the Dharma up to when they will have entered into complete nirvāṇa in the realm of nirvāṇa without any remainder of the aggregates, and you should dedicate [those roots of virtue] to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ston to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ston to //
translated: Thus, Subhūti, the bodhisattvas, the great beings, should teach the perfection of wisdom to the bodhisattvas, the great beings, and they should teach the perfection of wisdom to the bodhisattvas, the great beings in such a way.

original: brgya byin gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis gsol pa /
